entry.title: How to upgrade the General Store in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
The General Store in Fields of Mistria starts out with a fairly limited list of stock available to purchase. Although you can get by with the early items, it’s a good idea to upgrade the General Store once you’re able to.
Unfortunately, you’re going to have to check off a few things before you can finally upgrade the General Store, so do the following first:
Unlock the Mines and reach level 20
Break the Water Seal on level 20 of the Mines
Repair the Mill
How to upgrade the General Store in Fields of Mistria
Screenshot by Destructoid
The quest to begin the upgrade process for the General Store will come in the form of a letter in the mail from Adeline shortly after you finish repairing the Mill. The quest itself works in the same way as repairing the Bridge and Mill, with a donations box where you need to put the following resources:
300 Wood
500 Stone
5 Copper Ingots
5 Iron Ingots
The Iron Ingots are the reason you need to break through the Water Seal in order to get this quest completed. Iron Ore is only available on floors 21-40 of the Mines, which are only accessible once the first seal is broken.
You’ll also need a sizable sum of 3,000 Tesserae in order to complete the General Store’s makeover. Once you’ve raised this and placed all of the required resources into the donations box outside the Store, talk to Adeline to begin the upgrade.
What does upgrading the General Store do in FIelds of Mistria?
Screenshot by Destructoid
Upgrading the General Store expands the available stock, enabling you to purchase items which you wouldn’t have been able to before. After upgrading, you’ll find a new range of seeds, furniture, and cooking ingredients available.
However, the most exciting new item which becomes available for purchase is the second Backpack upgrade, which increases your on-player inventory to 30 slots.

entry.title: How to get the Unique Condemnation dagger in Diablo 4
entry.summary:
A new Diablo 4 season, a new chase for build-defining Uniques. If you're a Rogue looking to up their Combo Point game with Condemnation, you've got two pretty good options and a whole lotta quality of life to help you find it. All you'll need to do is fight two endgame bosses and cross your fingers.
How to summon Varshan and the Beast in Ice
Once you reach World Tier 3 by completing the Cathedral of Light dungeon in Kyovashad, you'll be able to summon and tackle endgame bosses. Each of them has their own loot table, but Condemnation drops from just two: Varshan and the Beast in Ice.
Varshan can be summoned within the chasm located next to the Tree of Whispers. As of season 5, it only takes Malignant Hearts to summon him, and if you've got other body parts from bounties or Grotesques Debtors you can turn them into Hearts at the Alchemist. What's more, you can summon him repeatedly without having to leave starting this season.
Image via Blizzard.
The Beast in Ice also got a lot easier to fight: just collect 9 Distilled Fear, which drops in Tier 30+ Nightmare Dungeons and head to the Glacial Fissure. No more crafting Sigils just to fight a boss, and, like with Varshan, you can summon him repeatedly.
Fighting these foes shouldn't be too difficult if your build is somewhat optimized and you've got maxed resistances (Shadow for Varshan, and Ice for Beast in Ice, duh). If you're really lucky, you won't have to fight them at all, since Condemnation can drop from regular foes at a very low rate. Happy farming!

entry.title: All Counter-Strike 2 maps in the Active Duty map pool
entry.summary:
Last year, the release of Counter-Strike 2 led to a resurgence in popularity for Valve's tactical first-person shooter franchise. A change of engine and a fresh coat of paint led to many of the game's maps looking fresher than ever.
In Counter-Strike 2, the Active Duty map pool determines the maps used in esports tournaments, as well as what can be played in Premier Mode. The pool is usually updated every 6-12 months, rotating maps in and out to ensure that the game never feels stale.
Image via Valve
Current Counter-Strike 2 Active Duty map pool
Here are the seven maps featured in Counter-Strike 2's Active Duty map pool at the moment:
Ancient
Anubis
Dust 2
Inferno
Mirage
Nuke
Vertigo
Of the current Active Duty CS2 maps, Dust 2 is the most recent addition. It was previously removed in November 2022, before being reinstated in April 2024, replacing Overpass. Dust 2's history spans as far back as 2001, so it's a classic that keeps players coming back for more.
Valve tends to be secretive about Counter-Strike 2 updates. Because of this, we don't quite know when the next update to the Active Duty map pool will come. Many CS2 professionals are outspoken about their dismay at the current selection of maps, so it might not be long before change comes along.
Competitive Counter-Strike 2 maps
Outside of the Active Duty map pool, there are also several CS2 maps that gamers can play in the Competitive playlist. While you can't search for these maps in Premier Mode, they still offer a good time. When Valve decides to switch things up in the map pool, these are the maps it will choose from when not adding a new one.
Bomb Defusal
Mills
Overpass
Thera
Hostage Rescue
Italy
Office
Some maps from Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, such as Cache, Cobblestone, and Train, have yet to return. Valve has yet to confirm whether they will come back in a future Counter-Strike 2 update.

entry.title: Ziggurat reconfirms Rendering Ranger R2 rerelease, releasing later this year
entry.summary:
Do you remember when Ziggurat announced a remaster of Rendering Ranger: R²? I had forgotten about it (thanks for the reminder, Gematsu). However, it has resurfaced as Rendering Ranger: R² [Rewind]. It’s coming to PC, Switch, PS4, and PS5 later this year.
Ziggurat’s press release states Rendering Ranger: R² is the most expensive SNES game in the collector’s market, which isn’t true according to PriceCharting.com. It is, however, the most expensive Super Famicom game.
It also describes it as a side-scrolling action game, which might seem rather vague, but that’s because it alternates between horizontal shoot-’em-up and terrestrial run-and-gun. It was created by some of the people behind Turrican and Giana Sisters. Weirdly, it only came out in Japan, despite Rainbow Arts Software being a German company. According to Ziggurat, it only sold about 10,000 copies.
As a note, it did get an SNES release by Limited Run Games in 2022/23. They are also listed as developing the re-release, which means it will be powered by their Carbon Engine. That means it will have rewind, save states, and CRT filters. It will include Rendering Ranger: R² as well as Targa, the unreleased Western version.
Rendering Ranger: R²’s big claim to fame (aside from its price tag) is its technical showcase. It makes great use of the console’s scaling and rotating abilities, and ties in some 3D-to-2D objects, not unlike Donkey Kong Country.
It’s always nice to see an obscure old game get another chance at finding an audience.
Rendering Ranger: R² [Rewind] is coming to PC, Switch, PS4, and PS5 later this year.

entry.title: Arena Breakout: Infinite early access release date set for August, includes a pre-load headstart
entry.summary:
After a month of beta testing earlier in 2024, Arena Breakout: Infinite now has a solidified release date on the horizon for its early access debut.
Morefun Studios has confirmed Arena Breakout: Infinite will be released in early access on August 12, 2024, at 7 pm PST / 10 pm ET / 2 am GMT (August 13). You can pre-load the game a day earlier for an ideal headstart. This is a little more than a month after its closed beta ended on June 28.
The devs didn't reveal any details about the game's full release yet. They have further mentioned players will be able to download the game files from their official website only during the entire early access period.
As a result, the Steam page for Arena Breakout: Infinite will be up the entire time but you won't be able to download the game from Valve's game client. So, if you want to jump back into the immersive tactical extraction FPS this August, downloading from their official website is the only way to go.
The early access will kick off with three maps namely Armory, Farm, and Valley. You can also choose from an arsenal of 48 unique weapons and there will be an all-new realistic climate system that will alternate between sunny and overcast weather conditions. Some other new features include a Kill Cam and an option to spectate.
"There's no wipe planned for now" the devs have confirmed. The primary areas of focus during the early access include "optimization, new features, fine-tuning gameplay mechanics, and balance monetization systems."

entry.title: How to catch Catfish in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
There are a lot of new fish to discover in Fields of Mistria, and every so often you’ll pick up a new quest from the Request Board which will ask for a specific fish. It can be hard to figure out which fish is where, but they can all be found if you know how.
One of these fish is the Catfish. At some point, you may get a quest to find one in order to unlock the Breaded Catfish recipe. This meal will a medium amount of stamina and energy when consumed, so it’s definitely worth learning.
Where to find Catfish in Fields of Mistria
Image by Destructoid
Catfish in Fields of Mistria, like they often do in the real world, inhabit the ponds and lakes of Mistria. This does limit where you can find them, but you do still have a couple of options for fishing locations if you want to have a change of scenery.
The first location is on the Eastern Road (shown above), in the ponds and lakes which are lined by Cattail Fluff. The second is up near the Manor House in Mistria itself, where Adeline and her family live. To the left of the Manor is a pond where you can also find Catfish:
Image by Destructoid
Either way, you might have to spend quite a bit of time fishing before you manage to catch a Catfish. They seem to be on the rarer side of fish in Mistria, so you’re likely to catch a lot of other fish in your efforts. On the plus side, a lot of these fish can be donated to the Museum or otherwise sold for a good of profit.
Thankfully, there are no weather or time restrictions surrounding Catfish that I’ve noticed, meaning you can catch them at any time of the year, regardless of whether it’s raining, snowing, or the sun is blazing down on you.

entry.title: How to get Murky Energy Residue in The First Descendant
entry.summary:
Murky Energy Residue is an essential resource in crafting characters and catalysts in The First Descendant. You don't get it by research but needs to be farmed and here's how you can do that easily.
You can use the Murky Energy Residue reagent to craft a Stabilizer for Valby as well as the Crystallization Catalyst. The best part about getting this resource is that you don't need to play the game in Hard mode and the farming process is quite simple too.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Best way to farm Murky Energy Residue in The First Descendant
Murky Energy Residue is mostly found in Sterile Land at:
The Forgottense in the Restricted Zone (Southeast corner of Sterile Land)
Unknown Laboratory in the Classified Area (Northwest corner of Sterile Land)
These two POIs are Calling of the Descendant missions where you have to defeat monsters to get these reagent drops. You can fast travel between these points by using either of the temporary or permanent Outposts.
The monsters drop approximately 10x Murky Energy Residues per run, sometimes more, so you'll need to defeat them quite a few times if you want to craft Valby. That's because Valby Stabilizer consumes 40 such reagents during its research process. This means you'll need to defeat this monster at least four times to get enough materials.
Best Descendant to farm Murky Energy Residue
Bunny is the best Descendant to farm Murky Energy Residue. After several trial runs using different Descendants, we found Bunny to be the most suitable candidate as she is fast and can deal splash damage to many enemies at once.
Bunny is also one of the best and least expensive Descendants you can unlock early in the game, so not choosing this character for these runs would be a no-brainer.

entry.title: Apex Legends akimbo weapons explained
entry.summary:
Apex Legends Shockwave Season 22 is live now, and it brings a new map among other additions to the game. Among those new features is the introduction of Akimbo weapons mode. This refers to the dual wielding of weapons in Apex Legends, where you have certain weapons in both of your hands to deal damage.
Even though akimbo weapons are fun to use in Apex Legends, there are some things to keep in mind about using two P2020s or two Mozambique together. There are certain buffs and nerfs attached to these combinations. For starters, weapons in akimbo mode turn into automatic weapons, meaning you can just hold onto that trigger and the weapon would continue to fire.
There are no optics available when weapons are in akimbo mode, so you only have the option to hipfire these weapons. To make up for this, Apex Legends players who wish to re-enable optics can holster the second weapon by using the select fire toggle input.
Image via EA
Respawn has added an increased rate of fire and has doubled the magazine size for akimbo weapons. However, there will be a longer reload time (since you have to reload two weapons at the same time). Given that akimbo operates in hipfire mode, looking down sights by aiming will slightly reduce the hipfire spread, so even if there is no optic in place, players shouldn’t forget to aim down sights for better accuracy.
So far, akimbo mode is available only for the P2020 pistol and Mozambique shotgun, making it possible to have two P2020s or two Mozambiques in battle. Akimbo weapons have added a whole new layer to how battles happen in Apex Legends, and while there are only two weapons so far that you can dual-wield, we will perhaps one day get to wield even two Wingman together.

This includes Iron Ore, a resource that can be quite challenging to locate. We're here to guide you on where to find Iron Ore in Fields of Mistria and what requirements are needed.
Fields of Mistria Iron Ore farming guide
To obtain Iron Ore in Fields of Mistria, you'll need to venture to Level 21 and beyond in the Mines. A barrier will block your path to this level, which you can overcome by unlocking the Water Seal with a few specific ingredients. Collecting a Ruby, Lantern Moth, Stone Loach, and Upper Mines Mushroom will grant you access to the area.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Before you go off into the Mines, ensure to bring a lot of stamina resources to reach the higher levels. The Full Restore spell can be excellent for this, as well as the Stamina Syrup from Valen's Clinic. You may want to pick up some healing remedies, too, just in case an enemy comes knocking at your door.
Once you've unlocked the Mines Level 21 in Fields of Mistria, use a Copper Pickaxe to mine the Iron Ores. Treasure chests and digging spots also provide more of this resource, spawning a whole bundle.
If you have some money to spare, you can purchase Iron Ore and other materials at the Blacksmith's Shop. Balor's Wagon occasionally has Iron Ingots, but they cost 300 Tesserae. With enough resources, you can upgrade your tools and expand their charging range. Additionally, Iron Ingots can be used during the Repair the General Store quest, which will be unlocked during the game's later stages.

entry.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 41: Kosmické novinky
entry.summary:
Horka polevila, ale žár nadšení Strahováků z techniky nepolevuje! Za poslední měsíc se stalo několik událostí doslova kosmického charakteru. Došlo k úspěšnému startu a vypuštění sond z rakety Ariane 6, Boeing vyslal Starliner na oběžnou dráhu, kde nyní jeho pasažéři neplánovaně už druhý měsíc setrvávají. KiCAD má novou verzi a blíží se konference k jeho dalšímu vývoji. Objevil se nový čip kombinující RP2040 s ethernetem a povedlo se na čipu vytvořit pulzní safírové lasery. Jsou vám tyto novinky málo? Pak jsou na Virtuální Bastlírnu připravená i obecnější hardwarová témata!
Za HW lze probrat zajímavé nově objevené parazitní jevy v SiC MOSFETech, jak se dá operační zesilovač "zaseknout" nebo k čemu jsou dobré ztrátové koaxiální kabely a kde je sehnat. Samozřejmě bastlíři narazili i na kuriozity, například doutnavkovou logiku nebo plošňák, jehož součástí je ohýbačka na THT součástky.
Software ani tentokrát nezůstane stranou - kromě již zmíněné nové verze KiCADu se dá podívat na stavbu linuxového managovaného switche, NanoKVM, převod videa z DisplayPortu na eink nebo emulátor NESu na Picopadu.
Jak je zvykem, s postupem večera se jistě přejde i k lehce bizarním tématům - kupříkladu, co provedl CrowdStrike, jak zprovoznit Doom na erotických hračkách pro pány, jak vypadá nestandardní 12V USB nebo jak se ztrácí některé části audio záznamů z CD, protože je většina SW neumí správně přečíst.
Příští Virtuální Bastlírna se pod taktovkou projektu MacGyver studentského klubu SiliconHill bude konat ve středu 7. srpna od 20:00 minimálně do 22:00 (ale obvykle končí o dost později). Odkaz na konferenci se před samotnou akcí objeví na bastlířské wiki.

Above your head hangs a painstakingly detailed mass of vents and cables, looming lifelike with dust and shadow and history. entry.title: Gothic Remake gameplay overview reveals an eccentric open world RPG that still feels like the future

It's a hell of a thing to showcase a remake weeks after kiboshing the developers of the original game. In early July, Gothic creators Piranha Bytes were reportedly shuttered as part of Embracer Group's mad race to trim costs, following their decade-long acquisition binge. Watching THQ Nordic's new Gothic Remake trailer, below, feels a little like watching a vivisectionist parade about in somebody else's skin. Still, the remake's developers Alkimia Interactive aren't to blame for Embracer's fuck-ups, and I am selfishly happy to see Gothic return as an Unreal Engine 5 production - even if I didn't play the original back in 2001.
Sin did play the original game, and in her 2016 retrospective, she paints an absorbing picture of a dark fantasy "microsociety" in which every community "has a reason to exist, a means of providing for itself, a social order, and a long term goal". entry.title: Metropolis 1998 is a fetching isometric blend of SimCity and The Sims, with customisable house interiors

Well, I got up this morning and made a small suburban village with a hospital, school, police station and a cafe in the space of 20 minutes. This is the backwater burg of Edwitherington. entry.title: Thank Goodness You're Here! review: edges towards greatness and won't take you long to beat
entry.summary:
British comedy is too often defined by its relationship to America: either as merely irony and sarcasm, which we're told Americans don't understand, or as a sprightly ideas factory for works such as The Office, which Americans can bless by re-making at scale.
Peel back the curtains of American cultural hegemony however and you may find the true pulsing core of British comedy that lies beneath: innuendo. No American network is in a bidding war to import Vic and Bob or remake Bottom, and Carry On and Benny Hill are assumed to be anachronisms in our modern times, but Thank Goodness You're Here! enters the conversation with a nudge and a wink. It's a cheeky 2-3 hour adventure through a small northern town, and it's here to educate the entire world of our nation's obsession with sausages and bare bottoms.
